div.head: Letter from Gerard to his sister, an electronic edition
div.p: I have for the first time attepted to write to you thinking that this duty must bea attented to you but as I was told in brother William's letter which comes to hand a few days ago that you thought that I had slighted you. I now take this oppurtunity of asking your pardon and hope that you will not fail to answer this letter or I will begin to think as you did as brother is very buissy you must not wait for him to answer this letter but you must do so yourself or I will think that you do not think enoughf of me to spend the time in writing a few lines me if it is not but a half a dozen they will bea very acceptable.

You mus tell all the young ladies that enquire after me that I am yet in good health but as I was not much of a ladies man when I was at home I think that you will not have to tell many of them so there is but few young ladies here but if there was a great many i would not have any time love with them as I am now very buissily engaged with my studdies which prevents me from writing you a longer or more interesting letter but you mus answer it as soon as possible and I will try and write you nmore in the mean time it is now of ten O' clock and allmost of all my time hasbeen taken up in this short litter ever believe me youre brother Gerrard.
